Package com.rapidminer.belt.reader

Class SmallReaders

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rapidminer.belt.reader.SmallReaders
  • public final class SmallReaders
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods for reading only small parts of one or more Columns.

    The methods in this class should only be used if there are special reasons that the methods from Readers cannot be used instead. When reading a whole column or table the Readers methods are more performant.

    Author:
    Gisa Meier

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • unbufferedNumericRowReader

        public static NumericRowReader unbufferedNumericRowReader​(Table table)
        Creates a new reader for row-wise reads of a single or a handful of rows of all the columns in the given table. All columns must be Column.Capability.NUMERIC_READABLE.

        This is only intended for a few reads and will be much slower than Readers.numericRowReader(Table) in most cases.

        Parameters:
        table - the table to read
        Returns:
        a reader for numeric-readable columns
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the table is null

      • unbufferedMixedRowReader

        public static MixedRowReader unbufferedMixedRowReader​(Table table)
        Creates a new reader for row-wise numeric reads of a single or a handful of rows of all the columns in the given table.

        This is only intended for a few reads and will be much slower than Readers.numericRowReader(Table) in most cases.

        Parameters:
        table - the table to read
        Returns:
        a reader for arbitrary columns
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the table is null

      • smallNumericReader

        public static NumericReader smallNumericReader​(Column column)
        Creates a new numeric column reader with a small internal buffer. Use this if you need to create several NumericReader at the same time and you cannot use a NumericRowReader via Readers.numericRowReader(com.rapidminer.belt.table.Table), which should be preferred.
        Parameters:
        column - the column to read, must be Column.Capability.NUMERIC_READABLE
        Returns:
        a reader for a numeric-readable column
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given column is null

      • unbufferedNumericReader

        public static NumericReader unbufferedNumericReader​(Column column)
        Creates a new numeric column reader with a minimal internal buffer. Use this if you need to use multiple calls to NumericReader.setPosition(int) with positions that are not known beforehand. If the positions are known in advance, calling Table.rows(int[], Context) with the expected rows first and then using Readers.numericReader(Column) should be preferred.
        Parameters:
        column - the column to read, must be Column.Capability.NUMERIC_READABLE
        Returns:
        a reader for a numeric-readable column
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given column is null

      • smallObjectReader

        public static <T> ObjectReader<T> smallObjectReader​(Column column,
                                                    java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Creates a new object column reader of the given type with a small internal buffer. Use this if you need to create several ObjectReader at the same time and you cannot use a row reader, which should be preferred.
        Parameters:
        column - the column to read, must be Column.Capability.OBJECT_READABLE of the given type
        type - the type as which to read the column
        Returns:
        a reader for an object-readable column
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given column is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if type is not a super type of the column element type

      • unbufferedObjectReader

        public static <T> ObjectReader<T> unbufferedObjectReader​(Column column,
                                                         java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Creates a new object column reader of the given type with a minimal internal buffer. Use this if you need to use multiple calls to ObjectReader.setPosition(int) with positions that are not known beforehand. If the positions are known in advance, calling Table.rows(int[], Context) with the expected rows first and then using Readers.numericReader(Column) should be preferred.
        Parameters:
        column - the column to read, must be Column.Capability.OBJECT_READABLE of the given type
        type - the type as which to read the column
        Returns:
        a reader for an object-readable column
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given column is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if type is not a super type of the column element type
